Perform Sensitivity Analysis for Differential Abundance

run_sensitivity_analysis.Rd

Runs differential abundance testing across multiple models, statistical methods, scaling approaches, and filtering criteria to assess feature stability.

Usage

run_sensitivity_analysis(
  expomicset,
  base_formula,
  abundance_col = "counts",
  methods = c("limma_voom", "DESeq2", "edgeR_quasi_likelihood"),
  scaling_methods = c("none", "TMM", "quantile"),
  min_counts_range = c(1, 5, 10),
  min_proportion_range = c(0.1, 0.2, 0.3),
  contrasts = NULL,
  covariates_to_remove = NULL,
  pval_col = "adj.P.Val",
  logfc_col = "logFC",
  pval_threshold = 0.05,
  logFC_threshold = log2(1.5),
  score_thresh = NULL,
  score_quantile = 0.9,
  stability_metric = "stability_score",
  action = "add",
  bootstrap_n = 0
)

Arguments

expomicset

A MultiAssayExperiment object containing omics and exposure data.

base_formula

A formula specifying the base model for differential abundance analysis.

abundance_col

A character string specifying the assay column to use for abundance values. Default is "counts".

methods

A character vector of methods for differential abundance testing (e.g., "limma_voom", "DESeq2", "edgeR_quasi_likelihood").

scaling_methods

A character vector of normalization methods to apply (e.g., "none", "TMM", "quantile").

min_counts_range

A numeric vector of minimum count thresholds to test. Default is c(1, 5, 10).

min_proportion_range

A numeric vector of minimum sample proportion thresholds to test. Default is c(0.1, 0.2, 0.3).

contrasts

A character vector specifying contrasts for the differential analysis. Default is NULL.

covariates_to_remove

A character vector of covariates to iteratively remove from the model for sensitivity testing. Default is NULL.

pval_col

Name of the column containing adjusted p-values. Default is "adj.P.Val".

logfc_col

Name of the column containing log fold changes. Default is "logFC".

pval_threshold

Numeric threshold to consider a p-value significant. Default is 0.05.

logFC_threshold

Minimum absolute log fold change for filtering. Default is log2(1.5).

score_thresh

A numeric value specifying a fixed threshold for feature stability. If NULL, it is determined based on score_quantile.

score_quantile

A numeric value (between 0 and 1) specifying the quantile to define stability threshold. Default is 0.9.

stability_metric

The name of the column in the stability table to use for scoring (e.g., "stability_score", "logp_weighted_score"). Default is "stability_score".

action

Whether to "add" results to the MultiAssayExperiment metadata or "get" them as a list. Default is "add".

bootstrap_n

Number of bootstrap iterations. Set to 0 to disable bootstrapping. Default is 0.

Value

Either a MultiAssayExperiment object with results added to metadata (if action = "add") or a list with:

sensitivity_df

A dataframe of differential abundance results across all tested conditions.

feature_stability

A dataframe summarizing stability scores for each feature.

score_thresh

The threshold used for stable feature selection.

Details

The stability score can be calculated in various ways. By default, stability_score is used, which multiplies the proportion of significant p-values across runs (presence_rate) by a consistency metric (effect_consistency). Users may specify alternative metrics like logp_weighted_score for more conservative feature prioritization.

If bootstrap_n > 0, the entire sensitivity analysis is repeated bootstrap_n times on resampled versions of the dataset, and summary statistics are returned for each feature's stability.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
result <- run_sensitivity_analysis(
  expomicset = expom,
  base_formula = ~ condition + batch,
  methods = c("limma_voom", "DESeq2"),
  min_counts_range = c(5, 10),
  stability_metric = "logp_weighted_score",
  action = "get"
)
} # }
